title: Two foreign donors who helped Giuliani on Ukraine are arrested: WSJ
text: Two foreign-born donors to a pro-Trump fundraising committee who helped Rudy Giuliani's efforts to investigate Democrat Joe Biden were arrested late Wednesday on campaign finance charges, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter. The newspaper reported that Florida businessmen Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman were the donors, who contributed $325 million to a pro-Trump super PAC. A transparency group had filed a complaint in July 2018 alleging they violated campaign-finance laws.
